concept.title: Field Hasher
concept.shortdesc: The Field Hasher uses an algorithm to encode data. Use Field Hasher to encode highly-sensitive data. For example, you might use Field Hasher to encode social security or credit card numbers.

conbody.p: Field Hasher processoroverviewprocessorsField HasherField Hasher provides several methods to enable hashing individual fields or the entire record. You can hash any field that can be converted to a string. The resulting hash is a string value.
Field Hasher uses MD5, SHA1, SHA2, or MurmurHash3 128 to hash field values.
